posts.content:
anybody know of a fuel gauge rebuild guide

or somebody who can rebuild my faulty gauge??

thanks in advance

boringusername wrote:anybody know of a fuel gauge rebuild guide

or somebody who can rebuild my faulty gauge??

thanks in advance
No, to your first question.
As to the second, gauges are rarely faulty - they either work or they don't. The problem is usually with the sender/earthing. You need to make sure that is not the problem before contemplating the gauge itself.
Another point to consider - it would be cheaper to buy another (tested) gauge than pay the labour charges and the there and back postal charges to someone who could sort it.
Yeah hear what you saying ,thinking ordering a repro one will be an easy option
